q: as the Director of Communications at 10 Downing Street. The move follows last month's resignation of ex-News of the World editor Andy Coulson amid continuing controversy surrounding phone-hacking allegations. The Prime Minister said: I am very pleased that Craig Oliver is to become the new Director of Communications at 10 Downing Street. Craig has formidable experience as a broadcast journalist. He will do an excellent job in explaining and communicating the Government's programme. WalesOnline, the best source for Welsh news, sport, business and entertainment. Asked about prospects for new gun restrictions, Representative Mike Pence , Republican of Indiana, asserted, I maintain that firearms in the hands of law-abiding citizens makes communities safer, not less safe. Some gun advocates insisted that there would be a battle over strengthening gun laws. Adam Nagourney reported from Tucson, and Jennifer Steinhauer from Washington. Ian Lovett contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

The Windsor plant could also produce Fiat models, he said, as he stressed the flexibility of the engineering in the future vehicles. You're going to see a new architecture on the line, a completely different architecture, completely re-thought, Sergio Marchionne told reporters after the event. The BBC's political correspondent Mike Sergeant said Mr Andy Coulson had become a "powerful political insider- precisely because he had a feel for the world outside Westminster" and the PM would be looking for a someone with similar nous and journalistic experience . , the new one can scarcely fail to generate more urgency. "I guess it's orange," said Brian Broom, of Decatur, as he retrieved his luggage from a Los Angeles flight. But it seems like it's always orange. Fair point. The last time the threat level was a different color-- 2006-- Michael Vick was still the starting quarterback for the Falcons, Shirley Franklin was mayor of Atlanta and Dunwoody wasn't a city.

humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home," Mr. Mike Pence wrote in the letter. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012.
